autoop.functional package

Submodules

autoop.functional.activations module

autoop.functional.activations.sigmoid(predictions: Tensor) → Tensor[source]

Compute the sigmoid of the input tensor.

Parameters:

predictions (Tensor) – The input tensor containing prediction values.

Returns:

A tensor with each value transformed by the sigmoid function,

representing probabilities.

Return type:

Tensor

autoop.functional.activations.softmax(predictions: Tensor) → Tensor[source]

Compute the softmax of the input tensor along the specified dimension.

Parameters:

predictions (Tensor) – The input tensor containing prediction values.

Returns:

A tensor where values represent the probabilities of each

class, summing to 1 along the specified dimension.

Return type:

Tensor

autoop.functional.feature module

autoop.functional.feature.detect_feature_types(dataset: Dataset, label_as_category: str | None = None) → List[Feature][source]

Detect the feature type for each feature in Dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Dataset object.

  • label_as_category – The column name of the label to be treated as a categorical feature.

Returns:

List of features with their types.

Return type:

List[Feature]

autoop.functional.image_processing module

autoop.functional.image_processing.create_image_dataframe(image_paths: list[str]) → DataFrame[source]

Create a DataFrame from a list of image paths including labels.

Note: This function expects the first character to indicate the integer label of the image.

Parameters:

image_paths (List[str]) – List of file paths to images.

Returns:

DataFrame where each row represents pixel values.

If labels are provided, a ‘label’ column is added.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Raises:

AssertionError – If any first character of the filenames is not an integer.

autoop.functional.preprocessing module

autoop.functional.preprocessing.preprocess_features(features: List[Feature], dataset: Dataset) → List[Tuple[str, ndarray, dict]][source]

Preprocess features.

Parameters:

  • features (List[Feature]) – List of features.

  • dataset (Dataset) – Dataset object.

Returns:

List of preprocessed features.

Each ndarray of shape (N, …)

Return type:

List[str, Tuple[np.ndarray, dict]]

autoop.functional.preprocessing.to_tensor(*arrays: ndarray) → tuple[Tensor, ...] | Tensor[source]

Convert one or more NumPy arrays to PyTorch tensors.

Parameters:

*arrays (np.ndarray) – One or more NumPy arrays to be converted.

Returns:

A single tensor if one array is provided,

or a tuple of tensors if multiple arrays are provided.

Return type:

tuple[Tensor, …] | Tensor

Module contents

Functional package of the autoop package. Includes the modules activations, feature, image_processing, and preprocessing.
